[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The UDPS defines requirements for managing, processing, and analyzing data workflows efficiently.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: UDPS supports batch and real-time processing, scalability, and secure communication while integrating with APIs, databases, and analytics tools.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: UDPS integrates with APIs, storage systems, and analytics tools for data management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: UDPS provides a web GUI and CLI for workflow management, monitoring, and analytics.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: UDPS deploys on cloud, on-premise, and distributed systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: UDPS supports standard OS and database integration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: UDPS ensures secure data transfer with encryption protocols.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: UDPS optimizes in-memory processing for high throughput.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: UDPS supports continuous operation with failover mechanisms.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: UDPS adapts to varied processing environments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 MISSING-TAG2: UDPS integrates with external analytics for extended processing.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: UDPS handles ingestion, transformation, analytics, and visualization of structured and unstructured data.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: UDPS relies on network stability, API availability, and data formats.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: UDPS assumes compatibility with APIs, database protocols, and authentication mechanisms.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Data Workflow: Structured data processing tasks.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 MISSING-TAG1: Designed for data analysts, engineers, and administrators familiar with data processing workflows.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with APIs for secure data ingestion (REQ-FUNC-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall ensure encrypted data exchange (REQ-ATTR-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive dashboard for workflow management and monitoring.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process up to 2TB of data per hour (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall ensure ACID compliance for data integrity.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall support unstructured data storage and retrieval.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The architecture shall support modular scalability and high availability.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with ISO/IEC 27001 security standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall scale dynamically for workload fluctuations.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall maintain detailed audit logs for compliance and debugging (REQ-COMP-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall support batch and real-time data workflows efficiently.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall provide analytics, including visualization and reporting.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Functional, performance, and compliance testing ensure system reliability.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Includes user manuals, API documentation, and setup guides.
[SEC] 5. References: ISO/IEC 27001, API standards, and database protocols.
